author: Jae-wook Lee, **Hyun-Sik Jeon**, Yong-Soo Choi*
title: Steering and Velocity Control Between Traffic Cones for a LiDAR-based Autonomous Driving Platform in Low-spec Environments
short_description: Implementing a simplified steering algorithm for obstacle avoidance (traffic cones) using LiDAR in low-spec environments.
abstract:
• **Problem**: Advanced autonomous driving typically relies on high-spec hardware, establishing a barrier to entry for basic research and accessibility.
• **Solution**: Focused on **utilizing LiDAR sensors in low-spec environments** (Windows 10, Python) to avoid small static obstacles. Implemented a **simplified avoidance algorithm** that detects traffic cones and generates target points for steering control.
• **Result**: Verified stable **maneuvering between traffic cones** through the proposed algorithm, demonstrating the efficiency of this simplified approach and **enhancing accessibility** for autonomous driving implementation in resource-constrained environments.
